thread.title: 'Bad In-Flight Announcements' Mocks The Horrors Of Flying
thread.title_full: 'Bad In-Flight Announcements' Mocks The Horrors Of Flying

author: Carly Ledbetter
title: 'Bad In-Flight Announcements' Mocks The Horrors Of Flying
text:
'Bad In-Flight Announcements' Mocks The Horrors Of Flying They get it. Carly Ledbetter Associate Lifestyle Editor,   08/21/2015 01:04 PM EDT 
Between screaming babies, wrestling for armrests and terrible airline food, flying can be the worst. Prompted by the woes of air travel, Comedy Central's show " @midnight " invited people to tweet out their best #BadInFlightAnnouncements suggestions -- in other words, things no one ever wants to hear over a plane's PA system. Boy, did they get some good responses. Kiss your loved ones, tonight's hashtag is #BadInFlightAnnouncements ! Check out these examples and play along! https://t.co/mbe8UppjXO — @midnight (@midnight) August 21, 2015 
Since some folks tweeted out both #BadFlightAnnouncements and #BadInFlightAnnouncements, we decided to pick out the best of both hashtags: Remember, there are not enough armrests for everyone, so may the odds be ever in your favor. #BadInFlightAnnouncements @midnight — Nick Dyer (@_NickDyer) August 21, 2015 #BadInFlightAnnouncements If you look over to your right you'll see @united airlines flight 1202 challenging us to a race...Buckle up folks. — Antonio Del Otero (@antoniodelotero) August 21, 2015 Alright folks, let's all have a listen to my demo tape. #BadInFlightAnnouncements @midnight
